The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion
The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''[[28 January|28]]''' - The letter "[[Cardinal Mindszenty]]", co-signed by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], is published in ''The Times''.
==February==
* '''[[15 February|15]]''' - Scholar [[Alexei Kondratiev]] is born.
* '''[[28 February|28]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 119]].
==March==
* '''[[11 March|11]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Miss Turnbull (11 March 1949)|a letter to Miss Turnbull]].
* '''[[16 March|16]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 120]].
*'''[[20 March|20]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] visits [[Hugh Brogan]] in [[Cambridge]].

==April==
* '''[[9 April|9]]''' - [[Sorcha Cusack]], who would play [[Goldberry]] in [[Tales from the Perilous Realm (1992 radio series)|''Tales from the Perilous Realm'' (1992 radio series)]], is born.
==June==
* '''[[4 June|4]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Pauline Baynes|a letter to Pauline Baynes]].
==July==
* '''[[13 July|13]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 121]].
* '''[[14 July|14]]''' - Tolkien author and screenwriter [[Brian Sibley]] is born.

==September==
* '''[[6 September|6]]''' - Author [[Robert Foster]] is born.
==October==
* '''[[20 October|20]]''' - ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - A fair, revised typescript of the finished ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' is made a copy.<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. lxxiii</ref>

==November==
* '''[[12 November|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Miss How|a letter to Miss How]].
==December==
* '''[[12 December|12]]''' - [[Bill Nighy]], who would play [[Samwise Gamgee]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|The Lord of the Rings 1981 radio series]], is born. 
* '''[[18 December|18]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 122]].
* '''[[20 December|20]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 122a]].
==?==
* '''?''' - [[Christopher Tolkien]] gets his B.A. English at Trinity College, [[University of Oxford|Oxford]].
* '''Autumn''' - Tolkien is introduced to editor [[Milton Waldman]].
